business.headline: Indiqube Spaces IPO: Should you invest? Check GMP and review by expertsIndiqube Spaces is aiming to raise Rs 700 crore through this IPO. The issue includes a fresh issue of 2.74 crore shares worth Rs 650 crore and an offer for sale of 21 lakh shares valued at Rs 50 crore.

Mumbai's luxury real estate market hits Rs 14,750 crore salesEven as affordability worsens for the middle class, Mumbai's luxury real estate market continues to soar, fuelled by billionaires, upgraders and a fresh pipeline of designer residences in coveted neighbourhoods.

SRK and Big B back this IPO: All you need to know about Sri Lotus DevelopersOther celebrities, including Hrithik Roshan, Ajay Devgn, Ektaa Kapoor, Sara Ali Khan, Tiger Shroff, and Rajkummar Rao have also invested in the firm as per reports.
CA explains why timing your investments matters as much as diversifyingCA explains that good investing isn't just about picking the right assets, it's about planning for the right moments.

Paytm posts Rs 123 crore profit in Q1: Is it a good time to buy the stock?Paytm's Q1 profit signals a turning point, but long-term sustainability hinges on regulatory clarity, competitive strength, and consistent execution across payments and lending. Investors must weigh promise against real-world pressure.
Deepinder Goyal adds Rs 2,000 crore as Eternal shares hit record highShares of Eternal jumped over 21% in the last 48 hours, hitting a new record high of Rs 311.60 on the NSE on Tuesday.
Sensex, Nifty open higher after US-Japan trade deal; Tata Motors leads gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up by 201.98 points to 82,388.09, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 63 points to 25,123.90 as of 9:27 am.
Will US-Japan trade deal weigh in on Sensex, Nifty today?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,181.50 as of 8:30 am, indicating that the Nifty 50 may open above Tuesday's close of 25,060.90.

IPO season heating up with Rs 2.58 lakh crore in queue: Is Dalal Street ready?After a steady first half, the second half of 2025 is expected to be packed with major public issues.  In July alone, 11 mainboard IPOs have either been listed or are set to launch.

CEO quits, HR head stays: Why Astronomer didn't fire Kristin Cabot over kiss cam rowAstronomer CEO Andy Byron resigned after a viral kiss cam video showed him and HR head Kristin Cabot cuddling at a Coldplay concert, sparking public backlash. While Cabot remains employed, legal experts say contractual obligations and internal investigations likely explain the delay in any action against her.

Paytm posts Rs 123 crore profit in Q1FY26, strengthens lead in merchant paymentsOperating revenue rises 28% YoY; contribution profit up 52% as AI-led efficiencies and financial services boost bottom line.

Who Is Anish Shah, the auto CEO whose salary nearly doubled to Rs 47 crore?Anish Shah, Group CEO and managing director of the Mahindra Group, entered the list of top 5 paid auto CEOs for the first time. He received a 95% hike in pay, with his total earnings touching Rs 47.33 crore in FY25.

entertainment.headline: Exclusive: Sara Ali Khan says trusting Anurag Basu in Metro In Dino came naturallySara Ali Khan shared her experience of playing Chumki in Anurag Basu's 'Metro... In Dino'. In an interview with India Today, she reflected on modern relationships and the freedom of working with a visionary director.

Jyothika celebrates Suriya's 50th birthday, actor waves at fans gathered outside homeActor Suriya turned 50 years old on Wednesday, July 23. His actor-wife Jyothika hosted a party to celebrate his milestone birthday.

Singer Dylan Marlowe kicked out of country jam festival, reacts to viral clipIn a TikTok post, country singer Dylan Marlowe revealed the reason behind his removal from the Country Jam music festival in Eau Claire, Wisconsin. The 'Boys Back Home' singer forgives the guard.

Aamir Khan congratulates team Saiyaara, praises Ahaan Panday and Aneet PaddaAamir Khan shared a heartfelt note congratulating the Saiyaara team for its box office storm, praising Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda for their stellar performances.

Anupam Kher's Tanvi the Great declared tax-free in Madhya Pradesh'Tanvi the Great' has been declared tax-free by Madhya Pradesh chief minister Mohan Yadav in the state.  The film addresses the struggles and dreams of an autistic girl.

Mohit Suri's wife Uditaa Goswami shares emotional note, calls him star-makerMohit Suri's film 'Saiyaara' is a big hit and currently a fan favourite. Amid the movie's success, the director's wife, Uditaa Goswami, shared an emotional post, calling him a 'star-maker' and praising his hard work.

Bobby to Saiyaara: Bollywood's timeless legacy of youthful musical love storiesAs director Mohit Suri's romantic drama 'Saiyaara' achieves a box office milestone, here's a glimpse into the youthful romantic musicals in Bollywood over the decades. What contributes to the cinematic spectacle when it comes to new-age love stories in Hindi cinema? IndiaToday.in shares insights on the Indian film industry's knack at romance sagas.

Netflix confirms All of Us Are Dead season 2 with fresh zombie threat. Watch'All of Us Are Dead' is set to return on Netflix with a new season. The second season will follow the aftermath of the zombie outbreak. A mix of returning and new actors will join the cast.

Boney Kapoor looks unrecognisable in new pics, loses 26 kgs without exercise: ReportBoney Kapoor has shed 26 kilos without setting foot in a gym, relying solely on a disciplined diet inspired by a heartfelt memory of his late wife, Sridevi.

Exclusive: Here's why Khan families gave Saiyaara trial a missSaiyaara has become the biggest hit of the year, earning over Rs 100 crore in just four days. The film's success comes despite a deliberately low-key release and why the trial didn't see many big names coming including the Khans.

Shahid Kapoor-starrer Chhatrapati Shivaji biopic shelved, director Amit Rai confirmsThe biopic on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, starring Shahid Kapoor, has been shelved. Director Amit Rai confirmed the development in a recent interview and criticised systemic issues in the film industry.

Ahaan's mother pours heart in special note, calls Saiyaara blessing of grandparentsAhaan Panday's mother, Deanne Panday, shared an emotional message as her son enjoys success with 'Saiyaara', reflecting on his upbringing and family blessings.

Karuppu teaser: Suriya unleashes full swag in RJ Balaji's action dramSuriya's birthday was marked by the release of the teaser for 'Karuppu', a film that promises a blend of cultural richness and high-energy storytelling. This cinematic glimpse has generated excitement among fans, showcasing Suriya in diverse avatars and hinting at a visually captivating and emotionally deep narrative.

Saiyaara box office Day 5: Ahaan's unstoppable film gets bigger Tuesday than MondayYRF's 'Saiyaara' has rocked the box office like no other love story starring debutants could do before. The film is looking at wrapping its first week in the range of Rs 160 crore nett, and that should speak for the kind of terrific traction it is receiving from the audience.

Why every actor now wants to play the villain in pan-India filmsBig stars playing villains are becoming a regular feature in pan-India films. From Rana as 'Baahubali's' Bhallaladeva to Bobby Deol in 'Animal', these roles are now stylish, powerful, and central to the story. But as more actors take this route, it raises questions about where the trend is heading and what it means for the future of Indian cinema.

Shraddha Kapoor steps out for Saiyaara screening with rumoured boyfriend Rahul ModyShraddha Kapoor was recently seen with her rumoured boyfriend Rahul Mody at the screening of 'Saiyaara'. In the video going viral on social media, the duo could be seen stepping out after watching the film.

Uorfi Javed shows swollen face after lip filler removal, reveals if she can speakInfluencer and reality TV star Uorfi Javed shared a video of her puffy face after lip filler removal. In the video, the 26-year-old revealed if she could talk after her face swelled after the procedure.

Mahesh Babu has been through a lot, says sister-in-law Shilpa ShirodkarTelugu superstar Mahesh Babu faced a heart-wrenching year in 2022 with the sudden loss of his father, mother, and brother, as revealed by his sister-in-law Shilpa Shirodkar. She praised his unwavering strength and support for family during these tough times.

AR Rahman pulls off a Chris Martin at US concert amid Coldplay kiss cam row. WatchAR Rahman took a dig at the Coldplay row at his concert in Washington, US. At the event, the cameraman focussed on the crowd when Rahman cracked the joke.

general news.headline: Op Sindoor Parliament discussion from July 29, government undertakes special prepThe move comes after days of uproar from the Opposition, demanding answers from the Prime Minister over US President Donald Trump's sensational claim that he "brokered a ceasefire" between India and Pakistan.

'Dal mein kuch kaala': Opposition speculation on Veep's exit refuses to dieCongress chief Mallikarjun Kharge suggested that some mischief was at play behind Jagdeep Dhankhar's sudden resignation and questioned the conspicuous silence of the government.

India reopens doors for Chinese nationals after 5 years, resumes visa servicesIndia had paused visa services for Chinese nationals after tensions reached an all-time high over border standoff post the 2020 Galwan clashes.

BJP targets Akhilesh Yadav over mosque meeting, questions wife Dimple's outfitBJP leader Jamal Siddiqui attacked the Samajwadi Party after several party leaders, including party chief AKhilesh Yadav and his wife Dimple Yadav, visited a mosque near the Parliament. Siddiqui accused the party of holding a political meeting inside a religious space and criticised Dimple Yadav for her attire.

In India, China inching closer, a Trump role he won't brag aboutThe deep chill in India-China ties seems to be over with Beijing welcoming Moscow's proposal for a tri-nation bloc. Though India and China are natural competitors, it is a realisation brought about by US President Trump's brazenness, Washington's slant during the Indo-Pak mini-war, and a mutual need that is making the two shake hands, albeit with Op Sindoor awareness.

F*** off, Indian: Student kicked, punched after parking spot tiff in AustraliaCharanpreet Singh, a 23-year-old Indian student, suffered brain trauma and facial fractures after being attacked by five men shouting racial slurs in Adelaide.

'Londonia envoy' caught in Ghaziabad; luxury cars, morphed photos with PM foundThe accused, Harsh Vardhan Jain, allegedly converted a Ghaziabad bungalow into a fake embassy for self-styled micronations, using morphed photos and fake diplomatic paraphernalia to dupe people.

Is Tamil Nadu set for a new phase of coalitions?The phrase defining this aspiration—'a share in governance... a share in authority'—was first articulated last year by the DMK's partner Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi

The 'Solidarity' Show: When US's top comedians united to roast TrumpA bevy of celebrities as well as late-night TV giants like Jimmy Fallon and Anderson Cooper assembled on Colbert's late-night show. Armed with sharp wit and wisecracks, they took on Trump.
SSVM Institutions: From Cradle to CosmosForging Futures with Foresight, Flair, and Faith

Air India Express flight to Doha diverted back to Kozhikode after technical glitchAn Air India Express Kozhikode-Doha flight returned to Kozhikode shortly after take-off due to a technical snag. Passengers were shifted to an alternative aircraft. The airline assured safety and apologised for the inconvenience.

Bengaluru women stripped on video, scammed by fraudsters posing as Mumbai policeTwo women in Bengaluru were scammed and blackmailed by fraudsters posing as Mumbai police. They were forced to transfer money and strip on video under threats of arrest. Police are investigating after the victims filed a complaint.

Can India make it 2-2 in Manchester Test? Here's what history suggestsENG vs IND, 4th Test: India will be looking to bounce back at the Old Trafford to make it 2-2 in the Test series after their narrow 22-run victory at the Lord's Cricket Ground.
Malfunction led to fuel switch shift? Final crash probe report in 6 monthsApart from analysis of the doomed Air India aircraft's black box, inspection of the wreckage is also underway.

Cash row: Supreme Court to hear Justice Varma's plea, Chief Justice opts outsJustice Yashwant Varma was divested of judicial work and sent back to the Allahabad High Court from the Delhi High Court in April after a fire broke out at his official residence in Delhi. During firefighting operations, bundles of cash were found in March, prompting an inquiry.

China is working on merging humans and machines in secret AI project, says reportChina is secretly working to gain AI dominance. According to a recent report, the country's research is chasing a literal merger between humans and machines.

Fluoride vs fluoride-free toothpaste: What's actually better for your teeth?As fluoride-free toothpaste gains popularity, the divide between natural health trends and dental science grows wider. While fluoride remains a dentist-recommended cavity fighter, growing consumer interest in natural alternatives is raising questions about what truly keeps teeth healthy.

US confirms Pakistan visit, fuels buzz of Trump-Sharif meeting in WashingtonTammy Bruce was responding to a reporter who asked for her thoughts on Donald Trump's past offer to mediate on the Kashmir issue - a proposal he had made while claiming to have prevented war between India and Pakistan.

Passenger records accident video after Rapido bike driver denies helmet to herIt all began when the Rapido driver refused to provide a helmet to the passenger, claiming it wasn't needed — despite not wearing one himself.

4th Test: Depleted and hurt, Gill's India hunt Lord's payback in ManchesterIndia vs England: Shubman Gill's India lost the Lord's Test match by a narrow margin. Depleted and hurt, the Indian team will look to hit back at England in the damp conditions of Manchester on Wednesday.

Bobby to Saiyaara: Bollywood's timeless legacy of youthful musical love storiesAs director Mohit Suri's romantic drama 'Saiyaara' achieves a box office milestone, here's a glimpse into the youthful romantic musicals in Bollywood over the decades. What contributes to the cinematic spectacle when it comes to new-age love stories in Hindi cinema? IndiaToday.in shares insights on the Indian film industry's knack at romance sagas.

Tanushree Dutta breaks down in video, claims harassment at home since MeToo rowIn a video, actor Tanushree Dutta claimed she has been facing harassment at her home since 2018, following the #MeToo movement. She broke down and said that she would be lodging a police complaint.

Cop exposes police-mafia nexus, accuses seniors of torture day before suicideA 51-year-old Madhya Pradesh cop was found dead by suicide inside his police quarters after recording chilling videos accusing his senior officers and a local sand mafia of mental torture and caste abuse.

Steeped in fanaticism, serial borrower from IMF: India blasts Pak at UNParvathaneni Harish also issued a strong message on the need for accountability in terror cases, citing the April 22 terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Jammu and Kashmir, in which 26 civilians were killed.

sports.headline: PV Sindhu downs sixth seed Miyazaki; Satwik-Chirag advance tooDouble Olympic medallist PV Sindhu defeated sixth seed Tomoka Miyazaki to reach the round of 16, while the world No. 15 men's doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty made a strong start at the China Open Super 1000 tournament on Wednesday.

Venus Williams, 45, becomes second oldest to win WTA Tour level matchWashington Open: 45-year-old Venus Williams became the second-oldest player after Martina Navratilova to win a WTA tour level match after beating Peyton Stearns 6-3, 6-4 on Tuesday.

Watch: Andre Russell wows Sabina Park with three sixes in farewell flourishAndre Russell, in his final international appearance, thrilled the Sabina Park crowd with three towering sixes in a single over, reminding the world of his explosive talent. Though the West Indies lost, Russell's farewell was a powerful tribute to his legendary T20 career.

Sai Sudharsan back for 4th Test: Navjot Singh Sidhu predicts India's playing XIEngland vs India: Former cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu has shared his predicted playing XI for the Manchester Test, backing Sai Sudharsan's return and questioning Karun Nair's place in the side.

Nitish Reddy's absence won't create much imbalance: Sanjay ManjrekarENG vs IND: Sanjay Manjrekar said that India may opt for a specialist batter to replace Nitish Kumar Reddy for the fourth Test in Manchester given their batting collapses in the series thus far.

Rishabh Pant as left back: Shastri, Lloyd pick Indian cricket's football XITeam India's visit to Manchester United's training facilities ahead of the fourth Test sparked a playful conversation between English pundits and Ravi Shastri about how the Indian cricket team would line up for a football match.

Watch: Harmanpreet wins heart with special gesture for six-star KrantiENG-W vs IND-W: Harmanpreet Kaur shared her Player of the Match award with Kranti Gaud and gave her an autographed ball after India won the third Women's ODI by 13 runs on Tuesday.

4th Test Day 1 Live Score: Rain looms over Manchester ahead of the matchIndia (IND) vs England (ENG), 4th Test, Day 1 Live Score Updates: Trailing 2-1 after a narrow 22-run loss at Lord's, India will be eager to draw level when the fourth Test begins in Manchester today. While overcast conditions are expected, forecasts indicate that rain is unlikely to disrupt play during the match hours.

Will Lionel Messi play? MLS All-Stars brace for clash against Liga MX eliteThe 2025 MLS All-Star Game in Austin, Texas, was expected to be Lionel Messi's first appearance in the event after injury sidelined him in 2024. However, that prospect appeared less certain following Monday's opening training session.

Harmanpreet Kaur wants India to pass the benchmark before ODI World CupA series win over England, anchored by her match-winning century, left Indian skipper Harmanpreet Kaur pleased-but far from content. For the captain, India's 2-1 ODI triumph is more than just a morale boost; it's a stepping stone towards a larger ambition-setting new benchmarks ahead of the 2025 Women's ODI World Cup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
